summary: The National Biotechnology Initiative Act of 2025 establishes a national initiative to advance biotechnology in the U.S. through enhanced federal coordination. It mandates the President to designate an interagency committee and a National Biotechnology Coordination Office to oversee activities across various agencies. The bill focuses on areas such as research and development, data and databases, product commercialization, regulatory streamlining, workforce development, and international partnerships related to biotechnology, aiming to boost national security, economic productivity, and global competitiveness.
